title: Hampstead Heath Circular Walk Route

images.caption: Cyclists and a pedestrian meet on the West Heath.

images.title: Martin Addison / Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Richard Slessor / Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Martin Addison / Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Glyn Baker / Footpath on Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Stephen McKay / Mixed Bathing Pond, Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mixed Bathing Pond. This pond is the uppermost of the three Hampstead Ponds at the southern end of Hampstead Heath, created in the 18th century by damming Hampstead Brook, a tributary of the River Fleet,to supply London with water. Mixed bathing is allowed here during the summer months.

images.title: Stephen McKay / Walking over Hampstead Heath, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Walking over Hampstead Heath. The heath has long been a popular place for Londoners to get out into the fresh air, as this couple are, strolling up from Hampstead Ponds at the southern end of the Heath.

description: This circular walk explores London's famous Hampstead Heath. It runs for a distance of just over 3 miles, visiting several of the parks' highlights. The large park covers 790 acres and contains miles of well laid out footpaths. You can climb the 98 metre (322 ft) high Parliament Hill for terrific views of major London landmarks such as Canary Wharf, the Gherkin, the Shard and St Paul's Cathedral. Along the eastern edge of the park are the pretty Highgate ponds which include three open-air public swimming pools. At the northern end of the heath you'll find Kenwood House. This former stately home is run by English Heritage and consists of gardens, ancient woodland and sculptures by Barbara Hepworth, Henry Moore and Eugene Dodeigne. Several long distance walking trails run past the heath - you could pick up Dollis Valley Green Walk, Green London Way or the Capital Ring if you would like to extend your walk. The route below is devised for walkers but cycling is also permitted on the heath but please be respectful of other users. Click here to see a map of the heath with the cycle route marked out.
